thread.title: Harry Potter gets second life on stage with new official story
thread.title_full: Harry Potter gets second life on stage with new official story | www.ajc.com

author: Cox Media Group National Content Desk
title: Harry Potter gets second life on stage with new official story
text: Harry Potter fans may want to start looking at booking a ticket to London for next summer. J.K. Rowling has announced that she collaborated a team to bring "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child" to life, fans found out on Pottermore. Where is Potter and his family years after the "Deathly Hallows?" Harry is "an overworked employee of the Ministry of Magic," Rowling said on Pottermore. He's also married to Ginny Weasley and the father of three school-aged kids as he deals with his past and his legacy. Albus Snape Potter "must struggle with the weight of a family legacy he never wanted." More than 30 actors will help bring the story to stage, when it comes to London's West End next summer. Tickets go on sale at 11am GMT on Wednesday for those who have registered for priority booking at HarryPotterthePlay.com. The general public can buy tickets on Friday.
